heaviest_rainfall.status: The most intense rainfall recorded took place on 04 January 2025, with precipitation totalling 36.8mm.  The rain fell at 4.6mm per hour at times over the course of the 37.2 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain was recorded on 02 September 2025 with a peak rate of 27.0mm per hour.  The storm lasted 15.0 hours and had a total rainfall of 21.19mm.

longest_rain.status: The longest rain storm on record lasted 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm of rain fell and at one point was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

storm.status: No stormy weather is anticipated.  The last big storm was recorded on 04 September 2025, lasting 1 days.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is no cold snap at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 cold snaps, with an average of 3.7 per year.

extreme.status: The record temperature difference stands at 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C), set on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is not a heatwaves right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 1.9.

tropical: The last tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and it has only happened 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current wind direction is southerly (181°), which differs from the average south-westerly (234.0°) by approximately 53.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The top recorded wind gust is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The largest wind run ever was on 21 October 2012 with a value of 1754 miles.

speed.status: The top recorded wind speed is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 3.1°C) and outside temperature (down 2.0°C) and more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 6%).

The past week and month had observable variation in feels like temperature (up 6.3°C), inside temperature (up 1.7°C), and dew point temperature (up 2.5°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 451.6m lower than yesterday, 72.3m higher than the past week, 813.3m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, the cloud levels ranged from a minimum of 835m to a maximum of 3910m, averaging 1733.6m; the past week and month had slightly higher averages of 1661.3m and 2550m respectively.
cloud levels.summary: A high cloud base will mean mostly sunny conditions.

summary.summary: Inside; a mild and comfortable temperature is anticipated. Outside; warm but comfortable temperatures are expected. Also, air moisture should feel ok and calm and still conditions are expected. A few light raindrops may fall, a high cloud base will mean mostly sunny conditions, and strong and powerful sunlight. The weather will likely remain the same.
